column4: i come on here every soo often and there is never really great support
though i am reasonable technical minded and know what i am doing sometimes small buggy updates are an issue
and always seems to skrew up the system
for a basic question it is good to get a reasonable simple answer

are you running drivers from the repos, kernel from the repos? Have you tried just reinstalling graphics drivers? Or considered just staying on older kernel (kernel updates within an Ubuntu release are by definition minor.)
i downloaded the drivers and installed the manually
just dont seem to be working at all now
then you would certianly need to re-install them for a new kernel version, and every kernel update. This is why drivers from repos are superior.
can i completely remove them and install the repo ones and if so, how can i do that?
is there a basic tutorial somewhere
need to wipe the old drivers id imagine
i'm not sure for ATI. it may be possible to just install the drivers from the repos and be OK.
i have tried many things but nothing working
